body:
AP Photo
By Kevin Robillard and Manu Raju
6/30/15 4:04 PM EDT
Former Democratic Sen. Russ Feingold will report raising more than $2 million in the second quarter for his rematch with Wisconsin Sen. Ron Johnson, a campaign official told POLITICO.
Feingold, a longtime campaign finance reform advocate, formally entered the race on May 14, about halfway through the quarter. He spent more than $14 million in his unsuccessful bid for a fourth term.
Story Continued Below
Johnson ended the first quarter with $1.5 million on hand after raising just under $1.3 million. The Republican self-funded his first run for office but said he prefers to not spend his own money on the 2016 campaign, expected to be one of the country’s most competitive.
By TED CRUZ
By JACK SHAFER
By SEN. MITCH MCCONNELL
By ANDREA MITCHELL
© 2015 POLITICO LLC
description: He's campaigning against Wisconsin Sen. Ron Johnson.
title: Official: Feingold raises more than $2 million in second quarter
